moves.title: General
changes: Many codes moved out of sound resource, significantly reducing memory leak crashes [DukeItOut]
Collision memory leak fix code added, which should drastically reduce the overall number of freezes [DukeItOut]
Fixed a bug where characters could unsnap from the ledge frame 1 when the game considered them both grabbing the ledge and onstage [Fracture]
Game crashes now display an error log and do not play the loud beep of death [Fracture & Uncle Punch]
Mario’s cape no longer applies super armor [Eon]
Platform drop momentum after getting your shield hit fixed to work normally [Eon]
Smash and Attack stick work properly during crawl [Eon]
Crawl momentum behaves normally in both directions [Sammi Husky]
Fixed numerous Subspace Emissary bugs related to Pokemon Trainer [Eon]
Teletether glitch fixed, Randall no longer interferes with tethers, tether displacement glitch fixed [Eon]
Nana no longer counts toward a victory star [Eon]
Using an aerial during knockback no longer causes missed techs [Eon]
Fixed a bug from LTE where All-Star mode CPUs would spawn in the break room [Eon]
Changed tap-jump meteor lockout timer to trigger on all jump inputs > 0.7 instead of > 0.715, fixing inputs that ignore meteor lockout, which are abusable by Smash Box, Box-likes, etc. [Eon]
Double jumping immediately after releasing ledge no longer forces a walljump [Eon]
Debug mode stability updated and now properly functions in Dolphin [Eon]
Clone Engine characters can become muted while metal [DukeItOut]
'Further improvements to overall system stability and other minor adjustments have been made to enhance the user experience'

moves.title: General Changes

changes.title: Training Mode received new options and QOL features [Eon]
changes: New Selectable CPU Behaviors: Shield, Crouch, DI in, Slight DI In, No DI, Slight DI Out, DI Out, and Slight DI (which picks between middle 3 options)
Holding Z when pressing Finish on the training mode menu will instead restart the stage + settings
Combo Meter is more lenient with what counts as a combo, now allowing for chaingrabs and techchases to count

changes.title: Special BOSS mode added [DukeItOut]
changes: If someone has a tag containing the word “BOSS”, “boss”, “Boss”, or “ボス”, then only players with those tags will experience special mode behaviors
When used with “CPU Characters Can Use Tags”, assign the tag first, then switch the character to be a CPU!
CPUs will now select between one of the 5 options of DI, instead of perfectly random DI, to better simulate how it would be with an actual opponent [Eon]
Strap screen skipped on startup [PyotrLuzhin] (only on Netplay build)
Screen KO’s have been removed during teams [ds22, Eon]
Character positions during throws have been modified
Holding L/R while scrolling through costumes will scroll though ¼ of the character’s costumes [DukeItOut]
3-2-1 GO! countdown removed from single-player games [DukeItOut]
Codeset system redone for more user/coder friendliness
Trophies added for Mewtwo, Roy, and Knuckles based on their character renders

moves.title: Gameplay Changes

changes.title: Two new C-stick options added
changes: Charge: holding the C-stick will charge smash attacks
Taunt: each direction on the control stick performs its respective taunt (replaces the individual taunt options that were there previously) [Eon]

changes.title: Item Throw Data Normalization
changes: Characters that had item throws release the item slower than frame 8 now release on frame 8
Characters that had item throws IASA later than frame 23 now have IASA on frame 23
Special exceptions apply to characters that spawn their own items, as well as Wario and Mr. Game & Watch, who throw on frame 12, IASA frame 20
All running item throws are now actionable twice as fast

changes.title: New Game Modes:
changes: Bomb Rain: Dodge Bob-Ombs in this frantic mode based on Sudden Death!

Wild Mode: Play on stages up to twelve times faster than the original while you’re moving at normal speed! Try it out with chaotic stages such as Summit, WarioWare (hold Y on loading to get constant minigames!), Lylat Cruise (hold Y for tilting!) or Spear Pillar for a truly wild experience!
In-game timer now displays frames instead of centiseconds [Eon]
Characters will no longer drop items when hit [Fracture]
Tech rolls now conserve momentum like Melee [Fracture]
Grabbing ledge now halts all momentum [Eon]
ECB now properly updates upon grabbing a ledge [DukeItOut]
Using normal get up from ledge does not trigger the ledge regrab lockout timer [DukeitOut]
Ledge occupancy of ledge rolls under 100% increased from 41 > 46 frames
Characters can no longer trip on banana during throws [Eon]
UCF-style shield dropping has been added [Fracture]

Footstool knockback has been normalized for all characters. All characters will fall 30 units before being actionable again. The number of frames spent inactionable when footstooled varies depending on fall speed
Characters can no longer be footstooled out of glide attacks [Eon]
Characters can now drift when hitstun prematurely ends [Eon]
Shield button while tripped goes into get-up [Standardtoaster, Magus, Eon]
Glancing Blow threshold is zero [Magus, Eon]
Window to wiggle out of tumble extended from 1 frame to 2 [Fracture]
Initiating a shield drop the same frame as a hard shield no longer causes wavelands [Eon]
All get up attacks and ledge attacks no longer clank
Negative Y-Speed from angle 365 attacks is capped at -0.5 [Eon]
Maximum distance behind that a character can be grabbed from capped to -6.5 units [DukeItOut]
Subspace Emissary characters now use the same variables as normal gameplay [Eon]
Slow-mo with the Timer item properly processes knockback in slow-mo [Eon]
Stickers no longer drop in versus mode [DukeItOut]

moves.title: Jab 1 & 2
changes: Jab 1 adjusted animation so that the first frame of hitboxes hit in front of him rather than completely to the side

moves.title: Up Tilt
changes: Added 3rd hitbox to sweet spot to match sour spot. Has the KB stats of the sour spot: but the angle of the sweet spot.
Up Tilt interpolation glitch has been fixed

moves.title: Down Smash
changes: Low Hitboxes pulled in slightly X Offset -9.4/11.2 > -8/9.8

moves.title: Standing Grab
changes: Grab X Offset 14.175 > 15.8, Middle grab box X Offset 11.7 > 10.07, Innermost grab box X Offset 7.2 > 6.2: Size 2.73 > 3.23

moves.title: Dash Grab
changes: Inner grabbox size increased in size to fix dead zone

moves.title: Neutral Special (Firebreath > Fireball)
changes: Fireball takes roughly 13 seconds to fully recharge, is lost on death, and does not recharge on the respawn platform
While uncharged, Bowser has access to a bite attack

changes.title: Fixed a bug where character actions wouldn’t update if thrown from a buffered Koopa Klaw throw. As a result: this slows down the fastest possible throw by 2 frames
Aerial Side Special, Down Variant
changes: If you hold the B button upon punching, Bowser will gain a small boost of momentum in the opposite direction of the punch
Fixed a bug where it could not do damage to opponents that were too close to the ground

moves.title: Other
changes: Crawl and Crouch armor reduced from 80/52.333 > 50/33
Bowser’s armor while charging smashes now works properly
Missed tech rolls given slightly more distance

moves.title: Costumes & Aesthetics
changes: Dry Bowser alt costumes now have blue fire effects
Eye animation adjustments made on back air, up air, and forward air
Sound quality of voice clip used for down taunt improved

moves.title: Jab
changes: Gentleman input is now the same on whiff or hit

moves.title: Grab
changes: Innermost Standing grabbox pushed outward slightly 2.27 > 3

moves.title: Down Special
changes: Knockback Stats lowered Strong/Middle/Weak: BKB 60 > 40, KBG 70/60/50 > 75/70/68

moves.title: Other
changes: Fixed a bug that caused Down B/Side B to ignore wall interactions when B-Reversed

moves.title: Costumes & Aesthetics
changes: Blood Falcon costume changed to Hell Hawk

moves.title: Attributes
changes: Fall Speed 1.7 > 1.85 (jumps and footstool hops have been modified to maintain original height)
Shield animation improved to better cover his head

moves.title: Forward Smash
changes: Active hitboxes pushed back three frames 7 > 10

moves.title: Neutral Air
changes: Hitboxes modified to better match his tail

moves.title: Forward Air
changes: Intangibility on Wings, Head, and Neck removed

moves.title: Back Air
changes: Sweetspot given to late hit +2% damage on tip of tail 9% > 11%

moves.title: Neutral Special (Flamethrower)
changes: Grounded: Damage 18%, Angle 361, BKB 50, KBG 82. After 6 frames, damage is reduced to 14%

moves.title: Down Special (Glide)
changes: Glide properly refreshes on all landings
Glide no longer infinite based on momentum, now terminates after 80 frames, GFX appear to signify that glide is ending
Glide will only consume one jump when used

changes.title: Height and Charge times modified. Format is frames of charge = distance.

moves.title: Other
changes: Forward/Back Roll distance increased by 5 units
Ledge options normalized to have similar IASA to the rest of the cast
Windbox-like hitboxes on up throw removed, corrected an error in the flags that prevented these hitboxes from being blocked
Missed tech get up rolls modified to move him earlier in the animation, and distance has been increased

moves.title: Costumes & Aesthetics
changes: Eye animation adjustments made to forward air, down special, and idle animation 2

moves.title: Forward Tilt
changes: Animation modified slightly to better indicate when hitboxes end

moves.title: Down Tilt
changes: Startup 7 > 6, Weak Hit Active frames 9 > 6, IASA 36 > 31

moves.title: Forward Smash
changes: Added a hitbox to address a dead zone near Dedede’s hands

moves.title: Forward Air
changes: Fixed dead zone by adding new flub hitbox on Dedede’s body: flub hit does 13% (normal hit is 15%)
Adjusted the animation slightly to prevent landing during start up

moves.title: Grab
changes: Fixed dead zone on standing grab by pulling in inner most grab box

changes.title: Adjusted in size and offset to no longer be low profiled
changes: Size 3.75 > 5.45, Y Offset 9 > 7.4, X offsets variously adjusted

moves.title: Up-throw
changes: Release point adjusted to be directly above him

moves.title: Side Special (Waddle Toss)
changes: Fixed a bug that would cause Gordo’s to occasionally get stuck in Dedede’s face

moves.title: Down Special (Jet Hammer)
changes: Jump Squat during Down Special matched to regular jump squat: 7 > 5

changes.title: DDD can now fall through platforms during mid air jumps
Dedede will now always win if the game ends via swallocide

moves.title: Costumes & Aesthetics
changes: Eye animation adjustments made on down smash, up smash, up tilt, and forward air

changes.title: Initial Hit:
changes: Back hitbox removed, BKB 60 > 65, Hitlag Multiplier 1.0x > 0.75x

moves.title: Neutral Air
changes: SFX on initial hit modified to sound slightly stronger

moves.title: Side Special (Monkey Flip)
changes: Can no longer be mashed out of
Now have 25 frames to input an option after connecting with the command grab, otherwise defaults to the meteor

moves.title: Other
changes: Dash attack and down b hand slap no longer stale each other

moves.title: Back Air
changes: Additional hitbox has been added to his knee to prevent whiffing

moves.title: Cargo
changes: Cargo hold made easier to mash out of

changes.title: Hitboxes that launched vertically now match Sakurai angle hitboxes

moves.title: Other
changes: Fixed visual bug on max charge punch
Grab release properly faces opponent away from DK out of cargo throw [Eon]
Cargo throw now decays naturally like normal grabs, mashing no longer the only way to break out

moves.title: Up Air
changes: Hitbox that does virtually no knockback on 2nd hit has been standardized to match the other hits

moves.title: Forward Smash
changes: Normalized inside hit to match regular angle

moves.title: Side Special (Falco Phantasm)
changes: Window for shortest shorten increased from 1 frame to 2

moves.title: Up Special (Fire Bird)
changes: Falco now has Fox’s up B flame hitboxes on startup
Flames do 1% per hit and loop 7 times

moves.title: Down Special (Shine)
changes: Fixed a bug that allowed Falco to grab ledge during his reflect frames

moves.title: Other
changes: DACUS distance normalized between first and second frame

moves.title: Side Special (Fox Illusion)
changes: Window for shortest shorten increased from 1 frame to 2
Ledge grabbox on startup added from frame 15-20

moves.title: Up Tilt
changes: Given a new animation and GFX, linking hit removed, KB stats matched to stronger hitbox

moves.title: Nair
changes: No longer reels backwards after the initial hitbox

moves.title: Standing Grab
changes: Animation slightly modified to give Ganon more horizontal range
Outer Grabbox: Y Offset 11.81 > 8.8: Z Offset 7.6 > 10: Size 3.91 > 3.95
Inner Grabbox: Y Offset 11.81 > 11: Z Offset 2.53 > 4: Size 3.91 > 3.95

moves.title: Dash Grab
changes: Boost grab distance made consistent on each frame

moves.title: Neutral Special (Dead Man’s Drift)
changes: Ganondorf has more control over his horizontal drift forward and slightly more control over his backward drift.
The rate at which he loses vertical height increases over time but much more slowly than vanilla.
Ganon can cancel Dead Man’s Drift slightly later in the animation with Cape 49 > 59

moves.title: Neutral Special (Cape)
changes: Hitboxes reworked to hit notably lower, and KB stats lowered to cause a true jab reset until around 50%-60%

moves.title: Up Special (Dark Dive)
changes: Start up slightly faster, first active frame 11 > 10

moves.title: Other
changes: Fixed a bug that prevented down/side special wall interactions when B-reversed
Fixed a bug that caused aerial side special to not fully connect with certain characters
Warlock Punch returns! Press the special button during side taunt to activate

moves.title: Costumes & Aesthetics
changes: Costumes can utilize their own unique weapons: TP, OoT, Pig and HW Ganon all have their own unique blades
Fixed an issue where OoT and Pig Ganon did not have light overlays during certain moves

moves.title: Side Special (Squall Hammer)
changes: No longer acts as a Brake

changes.title: Damage, Knockback, Size, and Angle made uniform between hitboxes
changes: Damage 1%, Angle 70, BKB 5, KBG 130, Size 4.15, Hitlag Multiplier 1.5x/1.0x > 1.0x
Removed an additional hitbox to slightly lower max damage

changes.title: Nana hitbox modified to decrease in power as she travels (Original is 16% BKB 60, KBG 85):

moves.title: Other
changes: Nana will not read inputs from Popo for the first two frames when sliding off of an edge when not near Popo
If Popo is grounded while Nana is airborne, or vice versa, Nana will never auto-turnaround
If Popo is either holding an opponent in grab, pummeling, or throwing them, Nana will not auto-turnaround unless she is in Wait
Z-Syncing window increased from 1 frame to 3
Nana made intangible on frame 1 of side b in order to prevent the fusion glitch from happening

changes.title: Nana’s damage output has been lowered on most attacks to offset the high synced damage output. Knockback has been compensated on every move so they hit exactly the same.

moves.title: Forward Smash
changes: Inside hitbox on his body removed

moves.title: Down Air
changes: Blue Aura effect added on spike hit

moves.title: Grab
changes: Standing Grab outside grabbox Y offset 9 > 7.2

moves.title: Side Special (Quickdraw)
changes: Aerial Landing Lag after going into helpless state 10 > 15
Fixed a bug that would cause Ike to have variable release timing if he landed during the start up of Quick Draw

moves.title: Neutral Special (Eruption)
changes: Aerial version no longer has armor unless fully-charged

moves.title: Down Special (Counter)
changes: Intangibility on attack increased by 1 frame to fully cover active hitbox frames

moves.title: Other
changes: Spike taunt BKB 20 > 50, sour spot damage 7 > 9
“Prepare Yourself” easter egg on forward smash moved slightly earlier during the charge

moves.title: Forward Tilt
changes: Looping hits angles modified to link more consistently
Added two strong hitboxes behind her to link into a launching hit more consistently

moves.title: Down Tilt
changes: Innermost hitbox size on second hit 6 > 4.5

moves.title: Up Smash
changes: Now charges/heals for all 7 active frames

moves.title: Down Smash
changes: Damage swapped between inside of vines and tipper, maintaining the consistency of tipper vine being the sweet spot

moves.title: Dash Grab
changes: Outermost grab box extended +1 units slightly more outward to better match vines

changes.title: All Healing moves reworked to heal and charge the following amounts

moves.title: Other
changes: Fixed a bug where Ivy’s model shaked rapidly when getting grabbed
SFX on Synthesis and Up Throw no longer depend on healing
Given costume specific razor leaf effects
Forward Air animation modified to no longer aerial interrupt on Battlefield Platforms
Given a third victory animation (Solar Beam) to match other characters

moves.title: Jab
changes: Jab 2 BKB 16 > 30, KBG 50 > 90, SFX modified to match power change

moves.title: Neutral Special (Rollout)
changes: Now ends in Fall as opposed to SpecialFall
Consumes all but one jump when used in the air, consumes no jumps when used on the ground
Upon a successful strike, Puff will be able to act again after a short time

moves.title: Up Special (Sing)
changes: Hitbox is consistent throughout, rather than refreshing three times

moves.title: Costumes & Aesthetics
changes: Eye animation adjustments made on down special

moves.title: Up Smash
changes: First hitbox comes out one frame earlier in the animation: 11 > 10
Weaker hits on the outside of his foot now match the strong hits

moves.title: Forward Air
changes: First two hits have been modified to better link into the third hit
Frames between second hit and third hit lowered from 6 > 4

moves.title: Neutral Special (Inhale)
changes: Windboxes will now pull shielded opponents toward Kirby

changes.title: Descending cutter (spike) damage 2 > 5 (KB is the same due to WDSK)
changes: The input for Cutter Dash has been modified slightly
Cutter dash can now be angled downward by holding down during the start up frames. Height restriction lowered from 3 units to 0.1 units

changes.title: Cutter Dash
changes: The input for Cutter Dash has been modified slightly
Cutter dash can now be angled downward by holding down during the start up frames. Height restriction lowered from 3 units to 0.1 units

changes.title: Stone Brake removed
changes: Early Hit: Damage 8%, Angle 90, BKB 30, KBG 90
Late Hit: Damage 6%, Angle 90, BKB 25, KBG 100

changes.title: When grounded, Down + Special will now perform a slide kick attack
changes: Early Hit: Damage 8%, Angle 90, BKB 30, KBG 90
Late Hit: Damage 6%, Angle 90, BKB 25, KBG 100

moves.title: Other
changes: Numerous hat changes have been implemented to make Kirby’s hats behave more like the character his is copying. This affects almost all characters.
Fixed an inconsistency regarding throw inputs: which had different thresholds compared to every other character.
Fixed a bug that prevented Kirby from getting his up special back out of grab release
Kirby will now always win if the game ends via swallowcide
Dash attack and cutter dash no longer stale together
Aerial down special will now hit enemies in SSE

moves.title: Up Smash
changes: SDI Multipliers on first two hits 1.0x > 0.5x

moves.title: Neutral Special (Arrow)
changes: Release point modified to better match visual

moves.title: Side Special (Boomerang)
changes: Release point modified to better match visual

moves.title: Grab
changes: All grabs have their active frames reverted to v3.5
Dash/Pivot tether grab box changed from having 1 hit grab box to having 2 smaller grab boxes next to each other

moves.title: Other
changes: Up Taunt - Sword Glow remains throughout instead of ending abruptly
Restricted to pulling two bombs at a time in order to prevent game breaking bugs
DACUS distance normalized between first and second frame

moves.title: Costumes & Aesthetics
changes: New Costume-Specific GFX: OoT Link alts replace Clawshot with Hookshot, utilize a different bow

moves.title: Up Smash
changes: Second hit repeating damage 1 > 2, stats and modified to link slightly better

moves.title: Up Air
changes: Priority has been swapped. Innermost sourspot (hip) > sweet spot > middle leg sourspot. Previously sweetspot had lowest priority.

moves.title: Up Taunt
changes: Self Damage lowered from 5% > 3% per tick (still charges 5 aura per tick)

moves.title: Neutral Special (Aura Sphere)
changes: Now requires releasing B to shoot Aura Sphere, allowing Aura Sphere cancels when fully charged

moves.title: Side Special (Force Palm)
changes: Fixed a bug where Lucario could waste aura upon landing with side special throw

moves.title: Up Special (Extreme Speed)
changes: Landing lag when ending on ground 18 > 24
Final hit always sends in the direction Lucario is facing
Fixed a bug that prevents Lucario from being unable to use Up Special on the ground a second time after using it already
Fixed a bug that prevented Lucario from being able to sweet spot on the left side of the stage while traveling straight
Connecting horizontally with a wall will rotate Lucario upward regardless of the direction he’s facing

moves.title: Other
changes: Aura Sphere graphic modified to pulsate only horizontally, instead of both horizontally and vertically
Fixed a bug that caused Lucario to turn around when throwing an item in the air
Run animation changed to reference canon

moves.title: Costumes & Aesthetics
changes: Lucario Aura GFX on his hands modified slightly to look cleaner
Lucario aura trails modified slightly, and aura no longer appears on the results screen
Eye adjustments made to up smash and up air

changes.title: All Offense Up smash attacks have been reworked to increase damage by 4% only. Knockback has been matched to the current iteration of offense up moves. The changes are as follows:

moves.title: Forward Air
changes: Strong hit active frames increased from 2 > 3
GFX modified to better match sweetspot

moves.title: Back Air
changes: Initial hit priority swapped between strong hit and weak hit (strong hit now has priority). Spike hitboxes remain unchanged

moves.title: Grab
changes: Standing grab animation modified to not flail wildly

moves.title: Neutral Special (Offense Up)
changes: Charge and Burst will no longer halt upward vertical momentum. Still stalls if moving downward

moves.title: Up Special (PK Thunder 2)
changes: Initial Hit Damage 8 > 5, repeating hit damage 3 > 2
Lucas can reverse ledge grab for 10 extra frames after PK Thunder 2

moves.title: Down Special (PSI Magnet)
changes: Looping hitboxes after initial hit no longer cause knockback

moves.title: Dash Attack
changes: Hitboxes modified to link slightly better

moves.title: Down Special (Luigi Cyclone)
changes: Variable that indicates use pushed back from frame 2 > 10

moves.title: Up Special (Super Jump Punch)
changes: Grounded version has reduced aerial drift

moves.title: Forward Smash
changes: Dr. Mario forward smash has electric gfx but has regular on-hit properties

moves.title: Down Special (Tornado)
changes: Mashing made easier but maximum height reduced slightly

moves.title: Costumes & Aesthetics
changes: Mario/Dr. Mario alt-skin given Fire/Electric GFX on forward air

moves.title: Down Tilt
changes: Removed the inability to shield during interruptible frames

moves.title: Forward Smash
changes: Adjusted arm rotations on forward smash to arc more naturally

moves.title: Down Throw
changes: Release point and throw animation adjusted to resemble melee

moves.title: Side Special (Dancing Blade)
changes: Dancing Blade colors are now based on the direction used instead of being a set order. Previously, the order was Red, Blue, Green, Red. Now, Up = Blue, Side = Red, Down = Green.

moves.title: Down Special (Counter)
changes: Intangibility frames on attack increased by 1 to full cover active hitbox frames

moves.title: Other
changes: Forward getup roll intangibility: 6-20 > 1-20 (Matched to be universal)
Fixed a bug where get up attack while face up started a frame late

moves.title: Costumes & Aesthetics
changes: Fixed issue where Marth’s eyes retained Brawl behavior on neutral special instead of looking forward

moves.title: Jab
changes: Fixed a bug where the front hitbox on the first active frame of jab didn’t connect

changes.title: Second hitbox from MK’s body (hilt) is now matched to the tipper hitboxes instead of the body hitbox

moves.title: Up Smash
changes: Frames between second and third hit 4 > 5

moves.title: Forward Air
changes: Hitboxes modified to reverse hit less often

moves.title: Back Air
changes: Sword trail GFX pulled inward slightly to better match hitboxes

moves.title: Neutral Special (Mach Tornado)
changes: No longer bounces off of the stage

moves.title: Up Special (Shuttle Loop)
changes: Glide Landing lag changed to a consistent 24 frames. Was 24/14 depending on time spent gliding, Reverse Shuttle Loop remains 30

moves.title: Down Special (Dimensional Cape)
changes: Instant Dimensional Cape BKB 40 > 20, KBG 103 > 114, Hitlag Mult 1.7x > 1.3x
Slash Reverse Ledge Grab terminates 4 frames earlier: 12 > 8
Full Dimensional Cape given the Dark Element and a new SFX
Fixed a bug that prevented Meta Knight from activating full cape if he transitioned from air to ground during the cape animation

moves.title: Get Up Attack
changes: Hitboxes reworked to not have a large hitbox behind him
Damage normalized with other get up attacks: 5 > 6

moves.title: Other
changes: Air Dodge normalized to the rest of the cast: ledge grabbox active 41 > 51
Upward facing missed tech roll backwards now matches forward roll
DACUS distance normalized between first and second frame

moves.title: Down Tilt
changes: Can now shield during interruptible frames

moves.title: Neutral Air
changes: Two Front Hitboxes X Offset of 4.3 > 2.8

moves.title: Grab
changes: Inside Grab Box X Offset 3.73 > 4.73 (reduces back grabs)

moves.title: Get Up Attack
changes: Large hitboxes on the side of him modified to be one large hitbox that covers the center of his body

moves.title: Other
changes: Tech Rolls modified to be far less ambiguous
Buffering Hover out of hitstun consumes double jump frame 1 (down from 11), using hover in any other instance does not immediately burn double jump
Fixed a bug that caused hover to automatically terminate if he acted out of aerial IASA
Fixed oversight where neutral special would not adjust arm position with charge increase
Shadow Ball wiggle modified slightly to increase with charge
Forward throw modified to prevent certain characters from stretching to a very large size for a frame
DACUS partially normalized between first and second frame
Air Dodge normalized to the rest of the cast: ledge grab box active 41 > 51

changes.title: Ledge occupancy normalized with the rest of the cast:
changes: Ledge occupancy on roll from ledge <100%: 56 > 46
Ledge occupancy on roll from ledge >100%: 80 > 55
Ledge occupancy on attack from ledge <100%: 56 > 43
Ledge occupancy on attack from ledge >100%: 70 > 51
Ledge occupancy on stand from ledge >100%: 60 > 45

moves.title: Costumes & Aesthetics
changes: Mewtwo now has costume-specific tail trail graphics
Mewtwo moved to his own soundbank, granting him higher quality audio
Jab audio adjusted to vary in pitch
Tail swing sound effects increased from 2 to 3; a lighter swing is used for up tilt and up air
Final Smash voice lines changed, given audio effects to match other characters
Eye adjustments made to forward smash, up smash, forward air, and forward throw
Fixed issue where most Mewtwo eye animations did not trigger while having a final smash glow

moves.title: Attributes
changes: Arms and upper legs are now grabbable

moves.title: Forward Tilt
changes: Active frames modified: strong hit 10-14, weak hit 15-29, IASA 38

moves.title: Up Tilt
changes: Hitbox duration reduced by 5 frames, animation adjusted to account for fewer active frames

moves.title: Down Tilt
changes: Hitbox shrunk down into two smaller hitboxes to better match the animation
Animation modified so that the manhole stops flipping when hitboxes terminate

moves.title: Up Smash
changes: Damage 21 > 20, KBG 100 > 95, head intangibility and active frames lowered from 5 > 3

moves.title: Back Air
changes: Looping hitbox damage 4 > 3 KB compensated, BKB lowered by 10 after compensation

moves.title: Up Air
changes: Can now autocancel starting on frame 18

moves.title: Down Air
changes: Landing hitbox on grounded opponents angle 270 > 290

moves.title: Forward Throw
changes: Release point modified to be in front of him

moves.title: Neutral Special
changes: Frames the meat article spends flashing after coming in contact with a surface 30 > 20
Angle control has been improved, holding up/down generates one of the two highest/lowest angles, holding nothing generates one of the middle three angles
Small bacon no longer prevents a large bacon from spawning
Only one bacon can be generated per Neutral B press

changes.title: 7 Hammer
changes: No longer heals, only drops Apple on hit

moves.title: Up Special
changes: Initial hit transfers into second hit 2 frames earlier in the animation 11 > 9
If used within 3 frames of Double Jump, your double jump will be preserved

moves.title: Other
changes: Tech roll animation modified to be less ambiguous
Fixed a bug that caused his Up Special to not refresh when being grab released
High knockback pain noise behavior matched to Melee

moves.title: Dash Attack
changes: Active frames increased on each hitbox from 1 > 2

moves.title: Up Tilt
changes: Head intangibility increased to match hitboxes 2 > 5

moves.title: Side Special (PK Fire)
changes: 4 frame delay added before pillar activation. This is so the hitlag isn’t instantly overwritten by the first pillar hitbox

moves.title: Down Special (PSI Magnet)
changes: Can grab ledge during end lag

moves.title: Up Special (PK Thunder)
changes: PKT1 no longer terminates when coming into contact with a hurtbox for the first 34 frames, hitlag multiplier has been reduced to prevent locking someone in place
If Ness transitions into special fall out of PKT2, his landing lag will be reduced from 20 > 10
PKT2 Intangibility frames granted upon hitting himself lowered 7 > 3

moves.title: Other
changes: Up Taunt Flash effect bug fixed

moves.title: All Smash Attacks and Aerials
changes: Excess shield damage has been removed from all Pikmin, with the exception of White. White Pikmin now do bonus shield damage, which increases with leaf/bud/flower > 8/12/16.
All Pikmin have been made intangible during the startup and active frames of Olimar's aerials

moves.title: Up Tilt
changes: Intangibility pushed back to from frame 1 > 5

moves.title: Up Smash
changes: Red Flowered Hitbox size increased to match other Pikmin and Leaf/Bud 5 > 5.74
Red Late Hitbox sized increased to match other Pikmin 4.75 > 5.74
Purple Strong Hit sizes decreased to match other Pikmin 6.5 > 5.74
Purple Late Hitbox size increased to match other Pikmin 5.5 > 5.74

moves.title: Forward Air
changes: Fixed an issue that caused Pikmin to go into the Z Axis during the later hitboxes

moves.title: Up Air
changes: Purple Angle 90 > 80, weak hit damage 8 > 9. KBG 90 > 100
White Early Hit: Damage 5/6/7 > 9/10/11, BKB 20 > 30, KBG 124/111/100 > 92/86/80. Late Hit: BKB 20 > 30, KBG 100 > 90

moves.title: Down Air
changes: Late hit Sakurai angle hitbox removed (it almost never hit anyway)
Fixed a bug that caused Pikmin to go into the Z Axis during the later hitboxes.
Fixed a bug that caused certain Pikmin's specific hitboxes to only hit aerial opponents.

moves.title: Grab
changes: Pikmin reach their max distance 3 frames earlier
Max distance shortened by a very small amount, hardly noticeable
IASA on all grabs increased by 2 frames

moves.title: Throws
changes: Yellow and Purple throws modified to match Red Throws, White throws remain weaker, Blue Throws remain stronger
Up throw on R/Y/P BKB lowered by 15
Electric Element removed from Yellow Down Throw special collision

moves.title: Side Special (Pikmin Toss)
changes: Clank Hitbox Damages all normalized to 10%
Poisoning removed from White Leaf/Bud latch attack
White explosion KBG set to 0, BKB set to 90
Pikmin will now attack a maximum of 5 times. This will still degrade with damage, but not until around 160%~. Mashing and attacking will still cause them to fall off earlier.

moves.title: Up B (Ionium Jet)
changes: Horizontal Distance added during up b 1.3 > 1 (this makes the base angle more upward than outward, allowing better backwards control)

changes.title: Hurtboxes
changes: Right Foot: X Offset 0 > -0.3, Y Offset 0.4 > 0.2, Y Stretch 0.4 > 0
Left Foot: X Offset 0 > 0.3, Y Offset -0.4 > -0.2, Y Stretch -0.4 > 0

moves.title: Forward Smash
changes: Now always starts on Golf Club (Cycle goes Club, Pan, Racket)

moves.title: Down Smash
changes: Damage of 3rd/4th/5th rotations lowered from 13/11 > 11/9, KB compensated
Added GFX that make the hitbox placement more clear, allowing for dressless alt costumes

moves.title: Forward Air
changes: Modified hitbox size and placement. A third hitbox was added in front of her to act as a “tipper” that does +1%, and has the light element. 1.1x hitlag multiplier added to make it +4 when FC'd on shield (matches other fair hits)
GFX modified so that sparkle matches crown

changes.title: Turnip hitboxes now refresh 20 frames after trading with an attack
Turnip Odds Changes
changes: Winky, Dot Eyes, and Stitch are all different colors
No Longer able to pull Bomb or Beam Sword

changes.title: Peach was given an aerial Down B hitgrab

moves.title: Other
changes: DACUS distance normalized between first and second frame

moves.title: Costumes & Aesthetics
changes: Since the hidden R alt costume lacks a crown, forward air makes a punch sound on impact, instead, when used with that costume
Eye adjustments made to back air and down air

moves.title: Up Smash
changes: Initial hit normalized to center hitbox, Damage 18%, BKB 40, KBG 110
Fixed bug that caused up smash to inflict no shield damage
New Iron Tail GFX and SFX

moves.title: Neutral Air
changes: Hitboxes modified to better cover his body

moves.title: Grab
changes: Outermost Standing Grab Box X Offset: 6.33 > 6.83

moves.title: Side Special (Skull Bash)
changes: Hitbox position modified to better cover Pikachu’s head

moves.title: Down Special (Thunder)
changes: Frames of endlag when struck by Thunder increased 37 > 49

moves.title: Up Tilt
changes: First hit modified to link more consistently into second hit
All hitbox sizes on the second hit of uptilt increased by 1

changes.title: Meteor hitbox removed and replaced with a normal launcher hitbox

moves.title: Forward Smash
changes: First active hitbox pushed back one frame 9 > 10
First hit modified to link more consistently into second hit

moves.title: Up Smash
changes: Reworked timings and knockback to link more consistently
Added new hitbox centered on his body to link more consistently

moves.title: Neutral Air
changes: Nair repeating hits: x1 Hitlag > x0.9 Hitlag, x1 SDI > x0.75 SDI (launching hit unchanged)

moves.title: Back Air
changes: Sword hitboxes now come out one frame sooner to match body hitbox

moves.title: Getup Attack
changes: Now has an addition hitbox to whiff less frequently on crouching characters

changes.title: Can now be B-Reversed in the air
Loses once per air-state glide on frame 9 now, instead of frame 14.
Glide Attack:
changes: All hitboxes normalized to have the following stats: 12 Damage, 50 Angle, 55 BKB, 70 KBG

moves.title: Others
changes: Side Taunts voice SFX is now taunt cancelable
Ledge stand intangibility <100% made to match the rest of the cast: 27 > 31

changes.title: Shield Size increased from 10.6 > 11
changes: Shield start animation adjusted so his arms do not poke out as much

moves.title: Jab
changes: Fixed an error in Jab 1/2 flags that caused certain hitboxes to only hit characters on the ground

moves.title: Dash Attack
changes: Damage on initial hit 6/7 > 8, KB compensated
Damage on late hit outermost hitbox 4 > 5, KB compensated

moves.title: Forward Tilt
changes: Angling Up/Down now increases/decreases damage by 1%

moves.title: Forward Smash
changes: Angling Up/Down now increases/decreases damage by 1%
After 3 frames, all hitboxes have their damage lowered by 2%

moves.title: Up Smash
changes: Initial hit can now hit aerial opponents
Modified the animation slightly so he doesn’t extend fully upwards prior to the hitboxes coming out

moves.title: Neutral Air
changes: Strong Hit active frames increased by 2, 15-22 > 15-24

moves.title: Down Air
changes: Animation sped up, first active frame 16 > 13

moves.title: Down Throw
changes: Added several hitboxes so characters take damage over time rather than all at once. Can hit other players on the screen

moves.title: Neutral Special (Robo Beam)
changes: Fixed a bug where pressing B on the first frame of fully charged beam caused nothing to happen

changes.title: Fixed a bug that would cause R.O.B to die/fly into the air when using grounded Side B
Hitbox becomes weaker after 10 frames of travel
Dash Attack Frame 2 transN translation 3.2 > 5.8
changes: This gives his boost grab slightly more distance

moves.title: Costumes & Aesthetics
changes: Now has double jump ring effects
New Costume-Specific GFX for side special

moves.title: Forward Tilt
changes: Sour spot: 60 BKB > 40 BKB, 70 KBG > 80 KBG
Sweet spot now takes priority over sour spot
Angling Up/Down now increases/decreases damage by 1%

moves.title: Down Tilt
changes: Now allows Shield directly out of IASA

moves.title: Up Air
changes: Sweet spot priority on up air reworked, the inner body hitbox now takes priority over the tip sour spot (tip still has priority over sword/hilt hitboxes)

moves.title: Down Throw
changes: Release point and throw animation adjusted to resemble Melee

moves.title: Neutral Special (Flare Blade)
changes: When nearly fully charged (flashing white), press A to activate a ranged critical strike!

changes.title: Double Edge Dance colors are now based on the direction used instead of being a set order. Previously, the order was Red, Blue, Green, Red. Now, Up = Blue, Side = Red, Down = Green.
All variations except for xxV and the 4th swings

moves.title: Up Special (Blazer)
changes: Ledge grabbox changed to match v3.5

moves.title: Down Special (Counter)
changes: Links bombs no longer bounce off of Roy’s counter
Intangibility frames on attack increased by 1 to fully cover active hitbox frames
“Soko!” added as an option for counter’s voice clips

moves.title: Other
changes: Fixed a bug with his clank animation that could cause him to die on sloped terrain
Fixed out of place hitbox on <100 getup attack
Forward getup roll intangibility: 6-20 > 1-20 (Matched to be universal)
Ledge getup roll intangibility: 1-27 > 1-39 (Matched to be universal)

moves.title: Costumes & Aesthetics
changes: Model has been updated slightly; black and blue costumes have slight color changes
Several sword trail and item swing sword trails edited to fix model and interpolation issues
Roy moved to his own soundbank, allowing for higher audio quality and more voice clips

moves.title: Forward Tilt
changes: Non-angled variant: 2 Outermost Hitboxes lowered 0 > 1.2 (change in X offset)
Forward tilt has arm intangibility from frames 3 to 6

moves.title: Ice Down Tilt
changes: Hitboxes now travel forward, but will not travel off of ledges

moves.title: Ice Forward Smash
changes: Stats modified: Damage 17, BKB 40, KBG 85, Angle 361

moves.title: Other
changes: Fixed a bug that caused Samus’s bury animation to be her wait animation

moves.title: Up Smash
changes: No longer able to double hit

moves.title: Dash Grab
changes: Innermost grab box pushed forward, X Offset 0 > 2
Middle grab box pushed forward, X Offset 5.47 > 6.47

moves.title: Neutral Special (Needles)
changes: Restricted to pulling 5 needles, down from 6

moves.title: Other
changes: Down and Back Throws now properly hit R.O.B.
Added an additional hitbox on her leg during <100% ledge get up attack

moves.title: Up Smash
changes: Initial Hit can now hit aerial opponents.
Fixed a bug regarding angle control

moves.title: Up Air
changes: Priority swapped so that inside leg hit has priority over his feet

changes.title: Second Kick modified to better link into third (both through numerous angle/kb modifications)

moves.title: Neutral Special (Grenade Pull)
changes: Grenade explosion hitbox size 15 > 12, BKB 60 > 40, KBG 70 > 80

moves.title: Side Special (Tranq Dart)
changes: Fixed a bug that prevented tranq from being reflected by Power Shields or the Franklin Badge

moves.title: Down Special (C4)
changes: C4 explosion no longer grows in size after first active frame, size changed to a constant 14 (was 10 or 17 depending on frame)
“!” Graphic Appears over Snake’s head and unique SFX plays when sticking his opponent

moves.title: Up Special (Cypher)
changes: Aerial body hitbox no longer grows in size on frame 5, hitbox shrinks after 10 frames of travel 3.25 > 2

moves.title: Other
changes: Snake can now move around during his box taunt by using the D-Pad
Fixed a bug that caused Snake’s grenade to load in center stage and cause mines it overlapped with to detonate
Snake's item hold jump squat has been reduced to match his normal jump squat 10 > 5
When landing from a grenade pull, Snake will experience 4 frames of landing lag as opposed to 0
Fixed a bug that caused his Up Special to not refresh when being grab release

moves.title: Attributes
changes: Gravity 0.111 > 0.122, jumps modified to maintain original height

moves.title: Dash Attack
changes: If Sonic connects with Dash Attack, he cannot cancel it into Grab

moves.title: Forward Smash
changes: Removed reel-in hitboxes that popped opponents upward

moves.title: Down Air
changes: Sonic can no longer drift during his descent

moves.title: Neutral Special (Homing Attack)
changes: Blast Attack no longer goes into special fall on whiff with a double jump but prevents additional usages of Blast Attack, whiff without double jump still puts Sonic into special fall

moves.title: Side Special (Somersault)
changes: Added a white overlay effect on Side B start up
Aerial repeating hits can no longer reverse hit
All repeating hitbox sizes reduced to 2.79

moves.title: Down Special (Spin Dash)
changes: All hitbox sizes greater than size 5 reduced to 5
Charge Hitbox SDI Multiplier x1.5 > x1.25
Sonic is locked out of using aerial footstool for 30 frames after using aerial down special

moves.title: Up Special (Spring Jump)
changes: Now always consumes his double jump

changes.title: Adjusted forward tech roll distance to better match early distance that back tech covers
Up Taunt animation reverted to v3.5 due to popular demand

moves.title: Costumes & Aesthetics
changes: New Costume-Specific GFX on run and attack trails

moves.title: Attributes
changes: Increased size of jab 1/2/3, dash attack, fair, bair, up air, dair, fsmash, crawl attack, ftilt, up tilt, both cliff attacks, both getup attacks, and Shell Shift by 5%

moves.title: Forward Smash
changes: Start up reduced, first active frame 15 > 12

changes.title: Strong Hit weakens an additional stage on frame 17 of the animation:

moves.title: Neutral Air
changes: Size increased, strong hit 5 > 5.25, weak hit 4 > 4.2

moves.title: Neutral Special (Water Gun)
changes: No charge fires 2 sprays, half charge fires 4, and max charge fires 8.
Speed and distance have been enhanced
Full charge animation has been sped up

moves.title: Down Special (Bubble)
changes: If Squirtle lands during the start up of Bubble, or during the active frames, his landing lag is reduced from 30 > 15

moves.title: Other
changes: Tech rolls have been modified to move more during the start up of the animations
Squirtle no longer shrinks during crouch, down tilt, and crawl

moves.title: Forward Air
changes: Flub hitboxes have been standardized, fair now only has sweet/sour spot instead of sweet/sour/even weaker sour spot

moves.title: Down Air
changes: Given a new animation to have less disjoint below him
Sword glow terminates sooner, hitbox active frames unchanged
Late hit spike damage 21 > 18, KB compensated

moves.title: Up Throw
changes: Fixed a visual error with character rotations

moves.title: Up Special (Spin Attack)
changes: Aerial hitbox angle 50 > 361, hitboxes modified to stay consistent throughout
Grounded linking hits hitlag x1.0 > x0.5
Grounded final hitbox size increased, active frames 1 > 3, KBG 160 > 175

moves.title: Down Special (Bomb)
changes: Bomb Multi Hit count lowered from 4 to 3, total damage 12% > 9%

moves.title: Other
changes: Forward and Backwards tech roll distance increased, end distance 35 units > 38 units
Forward and Backwards getup roll distance increased, end distance 30 units > 32 units
Head was increased in size, hurtboxes adjusted to match original head

moves.title: Costumes & Aesthetics
changes: New down air and smash taunt animations (Smash taunt mask is now optional)
Now drinks Grandma’s Soup instead of Lon Lon Ranch Milk

moves.title: Dash Attack
changes: Fixed an error on hitbox flags that prevented certain hitboxes from hitting aerial opponents

moves.title: Forward Tilt
changes: Angle of tilt determined at the end of charging, rather than the beginning, for consistency with smash attacks

moves.title: Neutral Special (Chomp)
changes: Head intangibility during Bite Hold removed

moves.title: Up Special (Corkscrew)
changes: Linking hits modified to no longer semi-spike opponents

moves.title: Down Special (Waft)
changes: Half Waft Charge Time increased 25 > 30 seconds

changes.title: Animation overhaul made to Wario. Animations modified or replaced for the following moves:
changes: Forward Tilt, Up Tilt, Down Tilt, Dash Attack
Forward Smash, Forward Smash Charging, Down Smash Charging
Forward Air, Neutral Air, Back Air, Up Air

changes.title: Eye adjustments also made for the following moves:
changes: Forward Throw, Back Throw, Pummel, Hold

moves.title: Forward Smash
changes: Modified to no longer link, but instead be a single hit
Strong Hit spacing is his claw, the ending burst hitbox has been shrunk a bit in size

moves.title: Neutral Special (Blaster)
changes: Laser WDSK: variable by distance > 28 WDSK
Laser KBG: variable by distance > 100 KBG

moves.title: Side Special (Wolf Flash)
changes: Window for shortest shorten increased from 1 frame > 2
Fixed a bug that causes the article to overwrite the KB of the strong hit
Both grounded and aerial flub hits matched to the stats of the aerial version
Input for angles has been modified slightly

moves.title: Others
changes: Claw swipe GFX cleaned up on forward air and jab

moves.title: Forward Smash
changes: Adjusted hitbox to better match animation, Y Offset 2.47058 > 5

moves.title: Up Smash
changes: Adjusted hitbox to better match animation, Y Offset 3.28125 > 3.98125

moves.title: Neutral Special (Egg Lay)
changes: Fixed a bug that causes a break out state when grabbed on certain frames
Aerial hitboxes fixed to match grounded hitboxes

moves.title: Side Special (Egg Roll)
changes: Adjusted hitboxes to better match egg, X Offset -1.88 > 0
No longer loses a jump when hit out of the startup of grounded side b
Gains a small boost of momentum upwards during the beginning of the move
Fall speed during egg roll increased from 1.5 > 3
No longer gains a boost of momentum forward when breaking out of aerial egg roll

moves.title: Up Special (Egg Toss)
changes: Grounded momentum and transition to air momentum adjusted to allow for easier slide-offs to grab ledge
Eggs no longer burst if coming into contact with a wall on frame 1
Eggs now have a smoke trail GFX

moves.title: Other
changes: Added a hitbox to face up get up attack to address a dead zone in the middle of his body
Modified tail hurtboxes to be much more clean and consistent
Fixed a bug where Yoshi can be shield poked from below
Fixed a bug where Yoshi couldn’t jump out of shield until frame 7
Fixed a bug where Yoshi would get stuck in shield if shield was held after a roll
Fixed a bug where Yoshi’s tongue would go into the Z-Axis during his dash grab
Numerous ECB changes to make waveland timing more consistent (credit to Sylnic)

moves.title: Neutral Air
changes: Final hitbox changed to be one large hitbox

moves.title: Up Air
changes: Auto cancel window moved back 1 frame to no longer be active during the strong hitbox

moves.title: Up Special (Farore's Wind)
changes: Aerial version’s Intangibility begins 3 frames earlier

moves.title: Other
changes: Dair/Fair/Bair hitlag multiplier on sweetspot modified 1.0x > 1.1x

moves.title: Costumes & Aesthetics
changes: GFX overhaul on magic attacks courtesy of Elf

moves.title: Neutral Air
changes: This fixes an issue where some characters were unable to ASDI down nair

moves.title: Forward Air
changes: Modified hitboxes in order to add an aerial-only set of hitboxes that promote better linking

changes.title: Landing hitbox now only hits grounded targets
changes: ZSS must now press ‘A’ in order to wall jump out of a successful flipstool

changes.title: Flipstool
changes: ZSS must now press ‘A’ in order to wall jump out of a successful flipstool

moves.title: Other
changes: Fixed bug on dthrow that caused release issues
All whip based attacks now stale properly
All parts of forward/upsmash now scale properly with charging
Fixed a bug where down air bounce and down b did not properly apply momentum during knockback

moves.title: Dash Attack
changes: Super armor lasts 8 frames instead of 4

moves.title: Down Smash
changes: Gave passive light armor during charging like the other smashes

moves.title: Forward Smash
changes: Removed the travelling hitboxes and just moved them to the explosion GFX call time.
Charging f-smash has a vacuum windbox

moves.title: Neutral Air
changes: Super armor time increased to 6 frames from 3

moves.title: Back Air
changes: Adjusted placement of initial hitbox to be more disjointed and now lasts for 2 frames instead of 1
Late hitbox more disjointed by ~4 units

moves.title: Down Air
changes: Now has Passive light armor entire time

moves.title: Side Special
changes: F-throw variant now deals knockback as if it were an attack and not a throw

moves.title: Aerial Up Special
changes: Made linking hits function more like bowsers (connects better)

moves.title: Down Special
changes: Initial hitbox now correctly has hitlag

moves.title: Other
changes: Cooldown after invincibility ends on rolls now halved
Dash animation now has sfx and gfx

moves.title: Other
changes: Any animation changes to Wario also apply to Wario-Man

moves.title: R no longer toggles pages, Start alts have been moved to R, hidden R alts have been moved to Y (including concert Smashville)
Respawn points on Battlefield and Final Destination centered
Stage crate and barrel aesthetic themes have been normalized so that they are appropriate to the stage they run on
PMBR Stages have been added:
changes: Delfino’s Secret now rotates 5 different phases and has smaller blastzones than 3.6
Metal Cavern is now symmetrical, camera adjusted to better cover the map. Platform lowered 0.02 units to fix a bug with Ice Climbers
Wario Land has expanded blastzones from 3.6
Dream Land has smaller blastzones from 3.6
All 1:1s of these stages have updated blastzones and designs

changes.title: (L-alt) Battlefield (Melee)
changes: Improvements made to material settings to improve visual quality
Features own tracklist, separate from the other Battlefield slots

changes.title: (Base) Big Blue
changes: Fixed issue where one of the cars was unwrapped improperly

changes.title: (Z-alt) Big Blue (no vehicles)
changes: Big Blue, but there’s only one platform!

changes.title: (L-alt) Bowser’s Castle (Hazard)
changes: Features brand new sound, camera and graphic effects!

changes.title: (Base) Brinstar
changes: Fixed issue where splatter effects wouldn’t trigger from cells if the bridge was breaking apart on its own

changes.title: (Base) Castle Siege
changes: Brand new, competitively-oriented layout with two platforms and walls

changes.title: (R-alt) Sieged Battlefield
changes: 1:1 of Battlefield. No longer makes whistling noises.

changes.title: (L-alt) Tower of Guidance
changes: Unique casual layout with revamped lighting
Features own tracklist to emphasize the atmosphere

changes.title: (Z-alt) Castle Siege (PM)
changes: Moved from base slot. No longer makes whistling noises.

changes.title: (Y-alt) Castle Siege (Brawl)
changes: Features own tracklist containing themes from Brawl not present on the base slot

changes.title: (Base) Clock Town
changes: Features platform arrangement based on Super Smash Flash 2!

changes.title: (Z-alt) Candy Constellation
changes: Casual stage with a half-pipe design

changes.title: (Base) Dead Line
changes: Wide, transforming stage similar to Green Hill Zone in design

changes.title: (Base) Delfino’s Secret
changes: Platform arrangement converted to a more competitively-friendly, 5-phase format
Lighting improvements made to make the background elements more pronounced against the foreground

changes.title: (Base) Dinosaur Land
changes: Yoshi’s Island (Melee) renamed to avoid having two slots with the same name

changes.title: (Z-alt) Dinosaur Land (Symmetrical)
changes: Mirrored stage featuring pipes on both sides and no walkoffs

changes.title: (Base) Dracula’s Castle
changes: Returns from Project M 3.0 in all of it’s glory

changes.title: (L-alt) Dream Land  (Winter)
changes: Features own tracklist with wintry theming

changes.title: (R-alt) Final Destination (Project M)
changes: 1:1 of Final Destination (Melee) based on Project M concept art

changes.title: (L-alt) Final Destination (Brawl)
changes: Features own tracklist based on the music on Final Destination in Brawl

changes.title: (L-alt) Flat Zone
changes: Altered to have a fixed camera, similar to Flat Zone 2

changes.title: (R-alt) Ridley Stage
changes: 1:1 of Dream Land, featuring unique animations

changes.title: (Z-alt)
changes: Stationary version of phase 2 of the base stage

changes.title: (Base) Golden Temple
changes: Competitively-oriented layout with two platforms stacked above each other

changes.title: (Z-alt) Jungle Hijynx
changes: Based on the background section of the layout, only

changes.title: (Base) Green Hill Zone
changes: Water does not glitch when shielding

changes.title: (L-alt) Halberd
changes: Static version of base stage on the deck of the Halberd

changes.title: (Z-alt) Halberd (Day)
changes: Static version of base stage when in flight

changes.title: (Base) Hyrule Castle
changes: Modified collisions on right wall to lessen the invisible gap

changes.title: (L-alt) Ganon’s Castle
changes: Floating island in front of the castle

changes.title: (Base) Infinite Glacier
changes: Is now always situated within the sea, as was originally planned

changes.title: (Z-alt) Kongo Falls
changes: Features new sound effects for the Zingers and Squawks the Parrot

changes.title: (L-alt) Hornet Hole
changes: Casual stage with sticky walls and flooring to get stuck within

changes.title: (Z-alt) Sunset Shore
changes: Casual stage featuring a unique aesthetic where you fight as silhouettes!

changes.title: (Base) Lylat Cruise
changes: Modified collisions under the wings to make them less capable of trapping characters underneath them
Fixed issue where the stage collisions and models could desync
Stage does not tilt by default, but hold Y when selecting to get back the tilting behavior from Brawl!

changes.title: (L-alt) Meteo
changes: Stage inspired by Venom from Melee

changes.title: (Z-alt) Lylat Cruise (flat)
changes: Modified collisions under the wings to make them less capable of trapping characters underneath them

changes.title: (L-alt) Dr. Mario’s Office
changes: Semi-casual stage on an office desk

changes.title: (Base) Metal Cavern
changes: Features new, flattened layout designed for competitive play
New visual detailing applied to the stage

changes.title: (Z-alt) Metal Cavern (PM)
changes: New visual detailing applied to the stage

changes.title: (Base) Metroid Lab
changes: Features new platform pattern inspired by Norfair’s in 3.6, altered to inhibit campy behavior

changes.title: (Z-alt) Metroid Lab
changes: Casual tri-plat stage with a twist: all three platforms are walls, and two are underneath the ledge!

changes.title: (Base) Mushroom Kingdom
changes: Features pipe entry noises and piranha plant hazards

changes.title: (R-alt) Mushroom Kingdom Mix
changes: 1:1 of Green Hill Zone, with a mixture of aesthetics from the NES era

changes.title: (Base) Norfair
changes: Reverted to 3.0 to avoid similarities to the new Metroid Lab arrangement

changes.title: (Z-alt) Phendrana
changes: Icy stage featuring a broad plane to fight across and platforms below the ledge

changes.title: (Base) Oil Drum Alley
changes: Hazard-filled stage based on the factories of Donkey Kong Country

changes.title: (Base) Onett
changes: Fixed issue where telephone lines were culled incorrectly

changes.title: (Z-alt) Piranha Heights
changes: Stage featuring grabbable piranha plants that can attack and pursue!

changes.title: (L-alt) Mario Paint
changes: PictoChat-inspired stage on a broad walkoff!

changes.title: (Z-alt) Abandoned Stadium
changes: Plays Spear Pillar’s tracklist, instead of PS2’s

changes.title: (L-alt) Port Town (Hazardless)
changes: Version of Port Town that flies above the track

changes.title: (L-alt) 75M
changes: 1:1 of Kongo Jungle, but without the barrel

changes.title: (Z-alt) Big Ape City
changes: A construction site featuring exploding barrels!

changes.title: (Base) Saffron City
changes: Fixed issue where the Poké Mart sign was not animated correctly
Made the shadow movements of the characters follow the day-night cycle of the stage

changes.title: (L-alt) Pokémon Stadium (Melee)
changes: Moved from Pokémon Stadium 2 to avoid confusion

changes.title: (Z-alt) Magnet Train
changes: A stage on an electric train featuring a rail hazard

moves.title: Smashville
changes: For all Smashville slots for this stage, hold Y to guarantee getting a KK Concert!!

changes.title: (Z-alt) Ultra Space
changes: Floating stage reminiscent of PS2 in terms of design

moves.title: Subspace (NEW!!)
changes: The game now considers this R.O.B.’s home stage

changes.title: (Base) Subspace
changes: Transforming stage based on the Great Maze’s dark fights

changes.title: (Base) Temple
changes: Collisions in lower section of stage made more flush with the visual model

changes.title: (Base) Training Room
changes: Features a pillar with a hitbox and a Battlefield platform arrangement

changes.title: (R-alt) P+ Stadium
changes: 1:1 of Pokémon Stadium 2 featuring a plethora of different game series music

changes.title: (Base) Venus Lighthouse
changes: A stage that splits in half!

changes.title: (L-alt) Mercury Lighthouse
changes: Features separate tracklist from Venus Lighthouse

changes.title: (L-alt) Wario’s Castle
changes: A flooded stage with a torrent and blocky terrain

changes.title: (Base) WarioWare, Inc.
changes: Split off from Wario Land’s slot
Hold Y after selecting to get constant minigames! You’ll know you’ve got it if Survival Fever plays!

changes.title: (Z-alt) WarioWare, Inc. (GBA)
changes: 1:1 of WarioWare, Inc. with a twist: you’re inside a GBA!
Like with the base stage, hold Y to get constant minigames!

changes.title: (Base) Yoshi’s Island
changes: Sound effects for rising matched to time of support ghosts rising

changes.title: (L-alt) Yoshi’s Tropical Island
changes: Casual stage with a plethora of platforms

changes.title: (Z-alt) Yoshi’s Island (Night)
changes: Flattened version of Yoshi’s Island with no Shy Guys or support ghosts

changes.title: (L-alt) Super Happy Tree
changes: Yoshi’s Island from the first Super Smash Bros. title, without the furthest cloud
